name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Now we can also take a look at the d3.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _In this case
column6: you can see the result is three. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _Because d3 matched the three distinctive query words

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Whereas d1 only matched two.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _Now in this case
column6: it seems reasonable to rank d3 on top of d1. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: And this simplest vector space model indeed does that.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: So that looks pretty good.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _However
column6: if we examine this model in detail
column7: we likely will find some problems. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: So here I'm going to show all the scores for these five documents.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: And you can even verify they are correct.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Because we're basically counting

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: the number of unique query terms matched in each document.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Now note that this method actually makes sense.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Right? It basically means if a document matches

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _more unique query terms
column6: then the document will be assuming to be more relevant. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: And that seems to make sense.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _The only problem is here
column6: we can note set there are three documents

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _And they tied with a three

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _So that's a problem
column6: because if you look at them carefully it seems that _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: d4 should be right above d3.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Because d3 only mentioned the presidential once.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: But d4 mentioned it much more times.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _In case of d3

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: But d4 is clearly above presidential campaign.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Another problem is that d2 and d3 also have the same soul.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _But
column7: the three words that are matched. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _In the case of d2

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _But in the case of d3

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _So intuitively

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Because matching presidential is more important though than matching about.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: Even though about and the presidential are both in the query.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _So intuitively
column6: we would like d3 to be ranked above d2. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _But this model

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _So that means this is still not good enough
column6: we have to solve these problems. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _To summarize

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: in this lecture we talked about how to instantiate a vector space model.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: We may need to do three things.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: One is to define the dimension.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: The second is to

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: decide how to place documents as vectors in the vector space.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: And to also place a query in the vector space as a vector.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _And third is to define the similarity between two vectors

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: particularly the query vector and the document vector.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: We also talked about a very simple way to instantiate the vector space model.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _Indeed
column6: that's probably the simplest vector space model that we can derive. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _In this case
column6: we use each word to define a dimension. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: We use a zero one bit vector to represent a document or a query.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _In this case
column6: we basically only care about word presence or absence. _

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: We ignore the frequency.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: And we use the dot product as the similarity function.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _And with such a

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: And we showed that the scoring function is basically to score

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: a document based on the number of distinct query words matched in the document.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: _We also show that such a single vector space model still doesn't work well

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: and we need to improve it.

name: 2 - 6 - 1.6 Vector Space Model- Simplest Instantiation (00-17-30).srt
text: And this is the topic that we're going to cover in the next lecture.
